Implements an Octree for WorldObjects. More...

enum  OctreeNodes {
  TOP_LEFT_FRONT, TOP_LEFT_BACK, TOP_RIGHT_BACK,
  TOP_RIGHT_FRONT, BOTTOM_LEFT_FRONT, BOTTOM_LEFT_BACK,
  BOTTOM_RIGHT_BACK, BOTTOM_RIGHT_FRONT
}
 Gives Names to Child Nodes of the octree instead of numeric values.

Detailed Description

Implements an Octree for WorldObjects.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

Octree::Octree (  ) 

Set up the Octree Node.

max_levels_ is set to 20000 and min_width_ is set to 0.

Vector3d Octree::new_node_center ( Vector3d  center,
float  width,
int  node_id 
)

This Method calculates the new center point of a node.

This takes in the previous nodes center, width and which node ID that will be subdivided. The Result is the center of the new node.

Parameters:
center The center of the parent node
width The width of the Octree Node box.
node_id The ID of the node

Octree& Octree::parent (  )  [inline]

Returns the parent of this node. This is node a boost::shared_ptr because the child nodes get destroyed before their parent.
